post.description: Example 1 Create a group with the name “asia.acphone.com” and max users “10000”, and add it under the parent group “acphone.com”.

get.description: Example 1 Create a group with the name “asia.acphone.com” by copying “europe.acphone.com” and add it under the parent group “acphone.com”.

put.description: Change the maximum users for the group “acphone.com”.

delete.description: Delete the group “antarctica.acphone.com”. All users, attributes, profiles, and templates defined for that group will be deleted. Because the “force” parameter is not included, the request will fail if this group has any content.

put.description: Example 1 Create a group with the name “asia.acphone.com” by copying “europe.acphone.com” and add it under the parent group “acphone.com”.

delete.description: Delete all the desktop devices in the group “acphone.com”.

post.summary: Create a group-attribute by assigning a value
post.description: Example 1 Assign the value “acphone.stun.com” to the attribute “stunServer” in the group acphone.com.

get.description: Get information on all the group-attributes in the group “asia.acphone.com”.

put.description: Change the value of the group-attribute “stunServer” in the group “acphone.com” to “newStunServer.acphone.com”

delete.description: Delete the group-attribute “XmppUser” from the group “acphone.com”.

post.summary: Create an attribute in a group
post.description: Add a new attribute “sipUserName” to the user’s default group.

put.summary: Modify an attribute in a group

delete.description: Delete the attribute “sipUserName” but only if its value is not defined anywhere.

post.description: Create a “groupUser” type of attribute pool to provide values for the attribute “LicenseKey”.

get.description: In this example, the attribute pool for the attribute “LicenseKey” has 3000 entries, of which 107 are assigned. This example omits some of the response for brevity. The first entry was assigned on October 6, 2011 to Bob Abbott. The second entry is not assigned.

delete.description: Delete the attribute pool associated with the attribute “LicenseKey”.

post.description: Create an entry (in this example, a license key) in the pool that provides values for the attribute “LicenseKey”.

put.summary: Assign or unassign an attribute pool entry
put.description: For the indicated entry (a license key in this example) in the pool that provides values for the attribute “LicenseKey”, specify that the entry is no longer assigned.

delete.description: Delete the indicated entry (98LJKD93JDOJ0LJ92SJS) from the pool associated with the attribute “LicenseKey”.

post.summary: Create a template in a group
post.description: Create a new template “desktopBasic” in the admin’s default group.

put.description: Replace all the current content of a template with the content specified in the PUT portion of the request. This example shows the template body but omits the HTTP headers (content-type and so on).

post.summary: Create a profile in a group
post.description: Create a new profile “PowerUser” in the admin’s default group.

get.description: Get profile information for the profile “Desktop”.

put.description: Rename the profile “mobile” (in the admin’s default group) to “std:mobile”.

delete.description: Delete the profile “Desktop_euro” from the admin’s default group. If the profile is not in this group, nothing is deleted.

put.description: Create a new profile PowerUser in the zippyphone.com group by copying it from the group acphone.com.

post.description: Assign the value “6000@acphone.com” to the attribute “voiceMail” in the profile PowerUser in the admin’s default group.

get.description: Get profile information for the profile “Desktop”.

put.summary: Modify the value of a profile-attribute
put.description: Change the value for the attribute “voiceMail” in the profile “PowerUser” in the admin’s default group.

delete.description: Delete the profile-attribute “XmppUser” from the profile “BasicUser” in the admin’s default group. In other words, remove the value assigned to the attribute “XmppUser” in the profile “BasicUser”. The attribute itself is not deleted from the group.

get.description: To retrieve SIP the domain name for a group. A group can have only one associated SIP domain.

post.description: Creates a named SIP enterprise (domain) for a Stretto group.

delete.description: Deletes SIP domain information for Stretto users.

product_id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific product for a given latitude & longitude. For example, uberX in San Francisco will have a different product_id than uberX in Los Angeles.

capacity.description: Capacity of product. For example, 4 people.
